title: Kinetic energy - relative kinetic energy of carts

content.question: At the instant shown in the figure, Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is moving to the right with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is at rest, and Cart <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> is moving to the left with speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. The kinetic energy of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> relative to Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is <math alttext="K sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></math> and the kinetic energy of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> relative to Cart <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> is <math alttext="K sub A C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AC</mtext></msub></math>. All three carts have the same mass. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="K sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="K sub A C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AC</mtext></msub></math>, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub A B, end sub, equals K sub A C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AC</mtext></msub></math>, because kinetic energy is a scalar quantity.

<math alttext="K sub A B, end sub, equals K sub A C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AC</mtext></msub></math>, because carts <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> have the same speed.

<math alttext="K sub A B, end sub, is less than K sub A C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AC</mtext></msub></math>, because Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is at rest and has zero kinetic energy.

<math alttext="K sub A B, end sub, is less than K sub A C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AC</mtext></msub></math>, because the speed of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> relative to Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is less than the speed of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> relative to Cart <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub A B, end sub, is less than K sub A C, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>AC</mtext></msub></math>, because the speed of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> relative to Cart <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is less than the speed of Cart <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> relative to Cart <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>.
